answers.answer: I would call and let your dr. know. Better to be safe...... Have you try putting your feet up for a little bit?

Maybe you should put some ice on them? Have you asked your doctor about an anti-inflamatory? Just looking at them would bug me and that could stretch your skin and cause abrasions. You're not even done with the pregnancy yet! I would ask my doctor over and over again! lol That can't be comfortable..and you don't want to damage anything in your feet or legs. When was the last time you talked to or showed your doctor?
I agree with the others.  I would def let your doc know and be very descriptive.  That just sounds like it could be unsafe.

Be very careful and tell your doctor fast, you may have what is common during late in pregnancy as pre eclampsia. It may raise your blood pressure and if that's the case this is bad for you and your baby and they will deliver you early to relieve you of these symtoms. If you dont have that then the doctor will tell you to keep your feet elevated. Good luck and post when you find out.

Yea i tried calling the doctor they are all on luch right now so i intend on calling once the phones are back on.  The major thing that has me worried is the blue spots or whatever it is and the fact that i have been really nasuous and had Diarrhea alot lately (sorry TMI i know)  I cant wait for this baby to come out!

If your are having diarrhea you better be taking lots of clear liquids while you wait to hear from your doctor. The blue spots are probably vericose veins, I'm very familar with that and they look like brusies and can get worse like mine but I doubt you will have this problem for long since your so close to giving birth. Tell the doctor everything you told us because you might just wind up with a baby this week!

i forgot to mention that i can't fit into shoes, socks or even flip flops, i have resorted to wearing slippers to work now....they barley fit at the moment.  LOL i look like a mess, i would love to have my baby soon, i cant wait to meet him and to feel better.
ok, so i talked to a nurse and she wants me to come in ASAP, so i am on my way down there and hopefully i dont get any bad news.  I'll update when i get back.
Good Luck!
when your feet get to big hun soak them in epsom salt and let us know how your visit goes!! well keep bumping till ya do!
oh, goodness!!!  you've had quite a pregnancy this time around, huh?!?!?!  you will have a lot of things to write in his baby book!  :)  good luck at the doc!!!
bumping lol
hope you're doing ok!
bumping, waiting for an update
i wonder what's going on if she hasn't updated yet...  what would they do at the doc if you have pre eclampsia?  is that something she would have to go to the hospital for?

yup, Preeclampsia can cause seizures if it's bad enough, and beings she has gestational diabetes it would make things more hectic. It can cause death in both the mother and baby, as having preeclampsia can even cause strokes in the mother.If she was bad off they may keep her over night to get things steadied. If her blood sugar has been out of whack as well, they could be trying to stabilize that as well.at 35 weeks, if the preeclampsia is bad enough, they sometimes induce labor as its the only way to get rid of it.

I really hope that she is ok. And the baby as well. I pray its not pre eclampsia but rather something less extreme. I had a friend whom had it and its not a good ending to a other wise happy storry.PLEASE UPDATE AS SOON AS YOU GET "A CHANCE"God Bless you and baby!
I agree, but maybe they just have her there to regulate her blood sugar levels. *keeping fingers crossed* I hope all is well.

I hated being the one to tell her that it might be pre eclampsia but I didnt want her to think that her symtoms were no big deal. I learned alot on the TLC and the Discovery channel by watching Special Deliveries and A baby story and it's about not only regular births but also situations just like that our friend. I learned alot about things I was going through with all my pregnancys. I've been watching it for about 8 years. It is very informative and it helps you ask your doctors straight forward questions about these pregnancy issues. My spelling and grammer sucks when i try to rush through my typing --so bear with me whenever you see me post.

KennedyDP5... If it's preeclampsia and it doesn't get any better within the day they'll deliver her.Delivery is the ONLY cure for preeclampsia/eclampsia.They look for Protein in the urine, as well as high blood pressure and swelling. It can cause strokes, heart attacks, and somtimes clots. not good... She's luckily far enough along the baby should be fine.GoingOnFiveKids~ I think you were right to suggest it. because it's so dangerous. it can get deadly within a matter of hours. I LOVE Special Deliveries and also... Deliver Me. they're my favorite shows, and I watch as much as possible, esp. because i"m high risk.
Whoops... BTS I missed your post.. lol, I read them all too fast, and see you mentioned delivery as a solution. :)
Bump...I hope your OK:)

well i'm back.  When i got to the doctor yesterday and he checked my blood pressure and saw how large my feet were, he sent me straight to L&D......i was there from 2:30 to alittle after 9.  They did an ultrasound on both of my legs and well as my belly, they wanted to rule out blood clots....which they did thank god.  The baby looked good and is measuring 6lb6oz already.....probably b/c of the gestational diabetes.  they did all sorts of tests including a non stress test.  They were more worried about me then the baby b/c my blood pressure and pulse were pretty high.  I ended up getting contractions that were a few minutes apart and only getting stronger so they gave me a shot to stop them and 2 bags of fluid.  They said that it was to early to deliver.  I didn't get to speak to my real doctor after all the tests, just a bunch of residents and they did mention that i had protein in my urine, but no one said that i for sure have preeclampsia.  But i am kinda assuming i do with everything that has been going on.  I was told to follow up with my regular doctor on the 28th like i have scheduled but if anything worsens, or i get close contractions like that again to make sure i call back ASAP.  So i guess its a waiting game now.....hopefully everything goes well.  I'm not sure this baby wants to stay in here much longer though, i have already had some contractions today but nothing real close or to consistant.
Please take care of yourself . Has your blood pressure returned to normal now? I would call your doctor and find out if he has seen the report and if it is preclampsia.

I'm so glad you're okay.  Yeah, my SIL gets the preeclampsia with all of her pregnancies.  She has had 3 so far.  Please be careful and watch your body and symptoms very closely.  She (my SIL) has gone to the doctor for a regular visit before and then sent straight over to L&D to be delivered immediately, so it can be dangerous.  Be careful!!!Take care and keep us posted!!!!

Thanks i will def. keep a close eye on things.  On the plus side i got to see a picture of the baby and he is absolutly beautiful!  And they said it looks like he has some hair! YAY.  I cant wait to meet him but at the same time i dont want him to come to soon and have issues.  Thank good its a long weekend and i can rest this weekend LOL
Wow, great to hear all is Ok now. Take it easy...

glad to hear you're ok (kinda)!  definately take care of yourself...  i competely know how hard it is to be able to just lay down and relax...  but please try as much as possible and let new dh do all the work!!!  :)  keep us posted w/ what happens.
I am glad to hear that everything is okay... How far along are you now?

THANK GOODNESS YOU'RE OK, I FEEL SO MUCH BETTER THAT YOU GOT CHECKED OUT AND WAS CLEARED HEALTHY ENOUGH TO GO HOME. I'M SORRY IF I SCARED YOU BUT THE WAY I SEE IT, IT'S BETTER SAFE THAN SORRY. SO HAPPY YOU'RE BOTH WELL. : )

LOL yea i am in pain still but at least i know the baby is ok.  Its a good thing i did go b/c if i didn't i probably would have had him that day LOL, they had to stop my contractions b/c i am only 35 weeks, and they want him to "cook" longer.  Thanks for everything though!

question: So as most of you know this pregnancy hasn't been a walk in the park at all.  I am currently 35 weeks pregnant and having SEVERE swelling in my feet and hands.  my feet are so huge that i have large creases were my foot and leg connect.  It lloks like i had a couple veins pop in one of them b/c there is dark blue/ purple spots.  i'm not sure what to do.  My legs and feet look like they are going to explode and when touching them they are extremly hard.PS> for those of you who don't know i have gestational diabetes as well and lately my sugar levels have been all over the place.Help me!
title: Not sure what to do
